project_overview.summary: The Palaeontology Gallery stands as one of the renewal projects of the Hong Kong Science Museum, offering a permanent exhibition that explores the challenges and evolutionary journey of life from the Ediacaran Period, which began 635 million years ago. The exhibition is divided into six zones that introduce five major mass extinction events that occurred in the Earth's long geological history. The exhibition features over 100 sets of precious animal and plant fossils from different periods.

featured_image_with_text.content: To enhance visitor engagement and learning, ioio has created multiple gamified experiences for the gallery. These interactive and intuitive prompts have been]designed to captivate visitors, inviting them to actively participate and immerse themselves in the educational journey.

featured_text_1.content: We have developed three interactive exhibits, namely "Land Buster," "Before They Vanish," and "Triassic Trekka," which are designed to immerse visitors in the wonders of the prehistoric time.

subtitle_and_body_1.subtitle: Land Buster
subtitle_and_body_1.body: Participants are invited to excavate fossils with a virtual archaeologist. As the game unfolds, their smartphone will seamlessly transform into a range of excavation tools, including a fossil detector, hammer, shovel, and more.

highlighted_content_with_gallery_2.title: Before They Vanish
highlighted_content_with_gallery_2.content:
"Before They Vanish" is an interactive game designed to educate younger visitors about the fascinating process of fossil formation. The game features hand-drawn animations that vividly depict the journey of how fossils are created.

In this engaging experience, visitors participate in a variety of tasks using simple gestures like quick tapping, swiping, and sketching, allowing them to build their own personal collection of fossils along the way.

highlighted_content_with_gallery_1.title: Triassic Trekka
highlighted_content_with_gallery_1.content:
"Triassic Trekka" presents an immersive exhibit that invites visitors to embark on a thrilling safari tour through a prehistoric environment. The tour encompasses three distinct scenesâ€”terrestrial, marine, and aerial. The scenes are projected onto an enormous 5-meter tall backdrop, amplifying the immersive experience of an interactive journey into the captivating world of the Triassic period.

In addition, visitors have the opportunity to delve deeper into each setting using on-screen binoculars positioned in front of the expansive curved projection. By "capturing" creatures within the scenes, visitors can unlock and explore detailed information about each species, enhancing their understanding and knowledge of the remarkable creatures of the Triassic period.
